reviewText: This is such a great show offering so many laughs that I only wish they would distribute all of the seasons on DVD.  I know lots of people would buy them in a heartbeat.

Title: N/A

reviewText: People always review what they like, but this show deserves some negative attention.  I saw a rerun recently (for nostalgia only, my grandfather liked this show and I watched it often with him) and it reminded me of the moronic and flat characters that got retread for nine years.  The characters are all consistently borderline mentally incapacitated (how is Dauber funny?), but I think the fact they are so stupid than most people makes us feel good.  The writing stinks with canned and predictable "alpha male" vs. "educated female" situations predominating every storyline.  I expect most people will disagree since you're only looking as a fan (hey, that's cool, I'm not critiquing YOU, just a show), but if there is some lone person looking to buy a dvd, please, everyone I have ever met begs you- BUY 'JOEY' first, even that garbage is more amusing.
summary: You'll LOVE this show after a lobotomy!

reviewText: I've seen all these before so I can just say this is a great show, very funny and set in MN, which is where I live too.  I think this would be a great gift, the package comes as kind of a notebook (looseleaf binder) flips open, discs are in page sleeved and one of my discs had a pretty good mark on it hope it plays I ran through testing each episode in ff and it seems ok, there's also a notepad after the dvd pages (two pages dvd) and it opens up to pages saying disc one and disc two episodes and names, then the pages are blank there after, this might sit in funny on some people dvd racks and no where on case doe's it say coach except flip parts of course, but it's cool if you don't mind it not conforming with regular dvds, it flips up like a notepad, not like a normal binder so there's no place to put the name coach.  enjoyNOTE!!!This dvd doe's not play full screen on my computer but doe's play full screen on my xbox to my flatscreen, so if your playing off comp to tv you may have issues, just try a regular dvd player to access full screen. Pig skin case is plastic not leather for those who care.  Still is cool, unique, but won't be able to read name on side because there is none, so you just have to recognize it for it's case.  Comes with two dvds in sleeves.

reviewText: Well, it's about time that one of the best laugh out loud sit coms is finally being release!!!! i have waited several years for this series to be released, and have had to rely on  re-runs that are either on at either 5:00 or 6:00 in the morning, which makes it hard to watch, we love the banter between Hayden and Luther,some of the best scenes are between these two.you can't help but laugh`.i'm not a hugh football fan, but, watching this show makes me want to be one. every one should go out to buy a copy of it when it comes out, because when you put it in your dvd player after work you will really have a good day!

reviewText: Fans of the television series Coach will be glad to know that the shows first season is available in a special limited edition. The Coach The First Season-Limited Edition DVD set is really awesome. The DVD's arrive in a lift up playbook style notebook that is made of the same material as a football and the design looks like a football. The lift up flap inside of the notebook features football plays.Inside of the notebook, are CD like sleeves that hold the discs. Two discs total arrive with the set. Inside of the notebook is a "playbook." The cover of the playbook says "Minnesota State University Screaming Eagles Play Book. Inside of the playbook, are episode descriptions for all fourteen episodes included with the set. The DVD set includes all thirteen season one episodes and a bonus episode from the shows second season ("Homewreckers").Similar to other recent Universal releases, Coach The Complete First Season DVD set includes a featurette about the greatest television shows of the '80s.Coach premiered on television in 1989. The series is about a college football coach (Craig T. Nelson), who his fair share of challenges dealing with his adult daughter and friends. Series stars also include Shelley Fabares and Jerry Van Dyke.Considering that Coach is not considered a television blockbuster, I appreciate the effort put into the limited edition set.
summary: I Particularly Like The Packaging & Appreciate The Effort

reviewerName: James Bennett "Second star to the right, and ...
reviewText: I remember when this show came out. I loved watching the relationship between Hayden, Luther, and Douber. Many people may think this is some stupid jock show, but I found it hilarious, and I am far from being a jock. I was sad to see it go off the air, but glad to be able to watch it in re-runs. The one thing I didn't like is that it only came on in the early morning time. Now that Coach is going on DVD, I will be able to watch it anytime. As far as a fun show for me to watch, and as for one I would watch with my family, I put this one right up there with Home Improvement.

reviewText: I have been a loyal fan of Coach reruns for years, and you made my day when I found out I can finally get it on DVD! Craig T. Nelson is not only a great dramatic actor, but he is also an outstanding comedy actor. Hayden, Luther, and Dauber are the funniest laugh-out-loud team ever! Every episode makes you feel great just watching it, and if you like to laugh, this is the TV series to buy. I watch these episodes over and over and never get tired of watching them. Thanks for finally getting "Coach" on DVD, Amazon--you're the best!!!!!

reviewText: I have to lend some credence to the lone negative review, that the show can be somewhat predictable and I hate canned laugh tracks across the board. However, overall it is MUCH better then the majority of American sitcoms, and the side characters are much better evolved then in most sitcoms. This from an avowed Britcom snob who lists Fawlty Towers, Are You Being Served, Chef, Coupling, AbFab, Red Dwarf, Men Behaving Badly, The Office, etc. etc., above anything put out on American TV. Plus the personalities of Coach and Christine fit me and the wife to a tee...., which makes it a five stars in my eyes :-)
summary: Liked it on a personal level
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the best sitcoms ever.  I was born in 76, and this show premiered in 89.  I never watched it when it first aired.  I think, because I didn't like football (and still don't like football),  that I wouldn't enjoy a sitcom about a football coach.  So I never gave it a chance.  Until a few years ago, I seen a few reruns on TV and was hooked.  The DVD release is a treat for me, because I don't have the USA network, and therefore haven't been able to even watch reruns.  If you are a Seinfeld fan, or Curb Your Enthusiasm fan...and like sophisticated smart comedy, you will like this series!  And if you are like me, and don't care for football...don't worry, you won't even notice the parts about football, because there is so much more going on besides that.
summary: One of the best comedies EVER !!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Season 1 for Coach began on ABC in Feburary 1989 as a mid-season replacement show. This show is really funny and made a name for Craig T. Nelson. I really like to see this show in it's early days when Hayden, Luther, Dauber and company laugh things up for the Minnesota Screaming Eagles! Here's a guide for season 1.1.) Kelly & The Professor 2/28/89Kelly tells Hayden she had a date with a faculty member, and he wants to know who.2.) Pilot episode 3/1/89Kelly's return to Minnesota for college awakens Hayden's paternal instincts, disrupting his relationship with Christine.3.) Kelly, Meet Christine 3/8/89Christine demands Hayden be truthful with Kelly about their relationship.4.) I'm in Love With a Boy Named Stuart 3/15/89Hayden gets to meet Stuart, Kelly's new boyfriend, at dinner, but the more he gets to know him, the less he likes him.5.) The Loss Weekend 3/22/89A losing streak makes Hayden unpleasant company for Christine.6.) Gambling for Meat 4/5/89Hayden suspends Luther for 30 days for gambling when he bets against the team and wins a steak at the Touchdown Club; but Luther think he has been fired, and takes another job.7.) 19 Candles 4/12/89Hayden plans a quiet birthday celebration for Kelly, who invites Stuart.8.) Parent's Weekend 4/19/89Christine is seized by an uncontrollable urge to get a look at Hayden's ex-wife, who's come up for Parents' Weekend.9.) I'm Sorry I Told You My Wife Was Dead 4/26/89Hayden consoles a wealthy alumnus' widow to secure a substantial donation.10.) Define Romance 5/3/89Hayden feels threatened when Christine dates another.11.) Who's Team is it Anyway? 5/17/89Although Hayden needs a victory in his last game for a winning season, he may be forced to bench his star player for skipping practice.12.) Hoot, Hoot, Hike 5/31/89The poetry of football is turned into ballet by Kelly's dance instructor, who envisions a pas de deux with technical advisor Hayden.13.) Dauber's Blow Out 6/7/89Anti-fun Riley Pringle of the Conduct Committee joins Hayden in supervising Dauber's season-ending party.This is the best show on TV and I'm glad Universal was able to give recognitizion. I hope to look for future seasons real soon!
summary: Coach a rocky start but showed better longetivity.

reviewerName: William M. Alexander "Reach for the top with ...
reviewText: For laughs, no other sitcom tops Coach. Sure, it's not sophisticated and borderline soap opera like many other so called "sitcoms" out there but that's the charm of it. I will happily place the Coach DVD collection right on a shelf with the equally funny and irreverent Seinfeld collection.
summary: Best TV sitcom ever. Glad to see it on DVD!
